# The `FileError` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class wraps a filename and another <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This class wraps a filename and another <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>.

In some cases, an error needs to live along a &#39;source&#39; name, in order to show more detailed information to the user.

Definition at line 1328 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.

### convertToErrorCode() {#a45155d03470f2ed2e7f1377ade027373}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::FileError::convertToErrorCode () const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Convert this error to a std::error&#95;code.

This is a temporary crutch to enable interaction with code still using std::error&#95;code. It will be removed in the future.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l01353">1353</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>, definition at line 103 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/testing/lib/testing/support/error-cpp">Error.cpp</a>.
